title: Object vertical position vs time graph

content.question: A <math alttext="5 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object is released from rest near the surface of a planet. The object’s vertical position as a function of time is shown in the graph. Which of the following procedures can be used to determine the strength of the gravitational field on the planet?

choices.label: Determine the average slope of the graph.

Use <math alttext="v sub y equals, v sub y 0, plus, a sub y times t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use <math alttext="10 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="0 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="v sub y 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="negative 40 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>40</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="v sub f y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>fy</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve for <math alttext="a sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>y</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Use <math alttext="y equals, y sub 0, plus, v sub y 0 times t, plus, one half a, sub y times t squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use <math alttext="10 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="0 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="v sub y 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="400 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>400</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="y sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="0 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve for <math alttext="a sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>y</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Use <math alttext="the fraction F sub g over m, equals g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use <math alttext="5 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="10 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve for <math alttext="F sub g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Use <math alttext="y equals, y sub 0, plus, v sub y 0 times t, plus, one half a, sub y times t squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use <math alttext="10 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="0 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="v sub y 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="400 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>400</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="y sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="0 meters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve for <math alttext="a sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>y</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
